intro: Tripleurospermum auriculatum, commonly known as the auriculate hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) base, giving it its common name. The bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
